abstract: As of Tuesday, Citigroup became the first major Wall Street firm to claim not only a foreign-born individual as its chief executive, but also the only one to have a knight as its chairman. That would be Winfried F.W. Bischoff, a German-born, South African-educated banker who joined Citi in 2000.
lead_paragraph: As of Tuesday, Citigroup became the first major Wall Street firm to claim not only a foreign-born individual as its chief executive, but also the only one to have a knight as its chairman. That would be Winfried F.W. Bischoff, a German-born, South African-educated banker who joined Citi in 2000.

headline.main: Behind the Citi Chairman’s Other Title
